title: 108_hr1276
content: The "American Dream Downpayment Act" is also known as the Downpayment Assistance Initiative under the HOME Program, amending the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act to provide downpayment assistance. The Secretary may grant assistance to low-income families for homeownership through downpayment assistance for single-family housing. Eligible families must be low-income and first-time homebuyers or include a uniformed employee. The Secretary provides downpayment assistance for low-income families, including uniformed employees or teachers, with income not exceeding 115% of the limit set in section 215(b)(2). The Secretary provides downpayment assistance for low-income families, with income limits not exceeding 115% of the median income of the area, or 150% in high-cost areas. To be eligible for a grant, participating jurisdictions must include a housing affordability strategy in their comprehensive plan. For a fiscal year, participating jurisdictions must include in their housing affordability strategy a description of grant use, a plan for outreach to residents of public housing, trailer parks, and manufactured housing for downpayment assistance, and actions to ensure suitability for homeownership. The Secretary allocates assistance for homeownership based on a formula considering a jurisdiction's need and prior commitment to homebuyer assistance. The formula may include minimum allocation amounts and factors like funding from various programs and State/local governments. The funding allocation for homeownership assistance is based on uniform, verifiable, and accurate data by State and local governments. Reallocation of funds to other participating jurisdictions is done according to established formulas. Grants under this section are not subject to certain provisions of the title, except as specified. Grants under this section are subject to specific provisions of title I, sections 215(b), 218, 219, 221, 223, 224, and 226(a) of this title, and subtitle F. Funds allocated or reallocated under section 217 or 217(d) are considered in the context of this section. "(g) Administrative Costs.--A participating jurisdiction can use funds for administrative and planning costs under this section, with a limitation based on the total funds available. (h) Authorization of Appropriations.--$200,000,000 is authorized for each of fiscal years 2004 and 2005. (b) Relocation Assistance and Downpayment Assistance.--Subtitle F is amended to include a new section for relocation and downpayment assistance." The Uniform Relocation Assistance and Real Property Acquisition Policies Act of 1970 does not apply to downpayment assistance under this title.
